intro: Cyperus surinamensis var. strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikelets that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in wetland environments, including marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
